reviews.text: We stayed at this room for 3 nights as my step daughter was in an all star games on the last day of the stay after winning the championship game we returned to the hotel to swim but where chases out because we had check out not to long before that we thought that since the whole team had stayed there for 23 nights that this was poor customer service I will never stay at any quality inn ever again I may just not stay at any choice hotel ever again
reviews.title: Good room crappy service

reviews.text: got a good rate with AAA discount for 2 rooms for our family of 5. The rooms are large with microwave & refrigerator - nice to be able to keep snacks when staying a few days. The breakfast is very good, but this holiday week the hotel is full and service is slow. This morning from when I got in line for a table til I got food was 50 min - so if in a hurry, skip and hit McDonalds a few buildings down the street. The wifi has worked well.
reviews.title: good for family trip

reviews.text: The indoor hot tub is nice but can get full
reviews.title: They can'd figure out their finances, don't stay there.

reviews.text: Location is great - Walmart, restaurants, movie theater nearby and easy to get to ski resorts.
reviews.title: I enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: Beds are comfortable. Staff has been friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great family hotel in Taos- 2 story suites with breakfast!

reviews.text: Honest to goodness, the hotel smelled awful...especially the side entrance which reeked of cat urine. The room was in disrepair, peeling wallpaper, dirty carpet and broken closet door's. I can handle outdated, but not filth. Breakfast was nice and dining room was well managed. However it didn't make up for the rest. I wouldn't stay there again for free
reviews.title: Smelly and Dirty- Yuck

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at this hotel. We traveled with our two small dogs. The hotel staff was friendly and tremendously helpful. Upon arrival, they assisted us with selecting the appropriate room for our stay (close to the courtyard). The room was very clean, the bed ultra comfortable. We enjoyed the free cooked-to-order breakfast; it is an outstanding restaurant. We did not use the pool area, but spent quite a bit of time around it with our two dogs and it looked very enjoyable and many people were using it. The property is very close to the plaza and also various stores to purchase additional essentials. We would DEFINITELY return to this hotel for it's reasonable cost for what you receive - and will recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay!

reviews.text: This was a very good motel. Nice room furnishings, very clean. Had everything we needed. The outdoor heated pool was very large and best of all, there was outside seating around the outside of the pool. Nice patio tables and chairs in the grassy area made for a nice place to enjoy the New Mexico weather. And breakfast was a bonus. You could choose from 4 different breakfasts which came with the room. It was cooked to order in their restaurant. We had eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, toast, orange juice and coffee. Not a long wait either. I'm surprised that this motel is not rated in the top 3 or 4 for Taos. It was reasonably priced also and right on the main strip near many restaurants. If you have kids, they will love the pool. The outside of the motel doesn't do it justice but it was well worth the money.
reviews.title: Great place to stay....much better than expected

reviews.text: Checked in to the Quality Inn after awful experience at slightly less expensive hotel nearby. We needed a pet freindly room and luckily, they were able to accomodate us late in the evening. The hotel is an older style hotel, but it's been kept up and is probably as nice as it ever was. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. Pool was clean and well maintained. We felt fairly safe staying here....unlike the hotel a few blocks away. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice, budget hotel

reviews.text: The room was very clean, neat and fairly roomy. The free breakfast provided with a stay at the hotel was better than most. You get one of the four set menu choices. The hotel has an outdoor heated pool and an indoor hot tub. Had an enjoyable stay and would recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Superb place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed here in April of 2013 for a night.
reviews.title: Decent place to stop for the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably one of the better places to stay in Alexander City. We sprung fo the "suite" (an extra $5), which was really just a standard room that was ever so slightly larger - just a bit bigger than a standard room with just enough extra space to hold an additional small loveseat and coffee table. Room had a small mini-fridge and microwave. Bathroom was clean and functional, with plenty of hot water. Location is convenient - right off US-280.
reviews.title: Nice stay, nice employees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably one of the better hotels I've stayed in in Alexander City.
reviews.title: bad odor and un vacuumed room,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were extremely friendly, especially John at the front desk. Every employee from the maintenance man to the front desk manager would greet you with a hello and smile. The rooms were clean, however not well sound insulated between rooms. The breakfast was very good. The data screens on the cardio equipment needs maintenance.
reviews.title: okay stay for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very nice place. If we ever returned to the Keys, we'd certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, Nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The big plus for this hotel is the helpful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Good value accommodation
unfortunately i was surprised
reviews.text: Although clean, the hotel is looking a bit tired in places but is priced accordingly. Room was comfortable and had free internet access that works first time.
Breakfast is the usual HI Express fare and perfectly adequate, although on the morning we were there the size of the breakfast area was struggling to cope with the number of guests.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel

reviews.text: Overall good value for money
reviews.title: Nice and quiet

reviews.text: after staying in other holiday inn express hotels, i have come to expect certain things,but not here. in the bathroom,other than the familiar towels and shower curtain, i could have been at a budget motel, an older sink with cig. stains.the only chair in the bedroom was a wooden dining room chair.the place is clean but a hampton inn alternative it's not.
reviews.title: Great hotel!
great inexpensive hotel
reviews.text: Great hotel to spend a night or two. Located on other end of Sturbridge away from busy spots. Great full breakfast with famous cinnamon buns.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older motel on the Paseo del Pueblo Sur (main drag) into Taos, New Mexico. I was at first a little apprehensive to try it based on the mixed reviews.
reviews.title: Older Motel But Great Value With Nice Extras

reviews.text: Check In- Check in was smooth. The clerk appeared to have been up for a long time and wasn't particularly friendly. The lobby looks like a motel right out of the 1960's with dark colors but it did bring back a nostalgic feeling. The hotel used a key rather than a card system.
reviews.title: An older property with great ammenities

reviews.text: The Room- The room which contained two queen beds was definitely dated and showing signs of wear. The beds were fine but a little lumpy. The window screens had tears in them and there was some paint missing in other parts of the room. However the room was exceptionally clean.
reviews.title: Avoid unless you have pets

reviews.text: The Managers Reception- Even on a Saturday night, which is a rare among hotels/motels they have a managers reception. There was a free minestrone soup which was quite tasty. Later in the evening each guest is given a free drink coupon and there is a large assortment of snacks on the table. Guests were friendly and it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Great location and lots of extras

reviews.text: The Sleep- The sleep was fine. There was no noise that I could here in the adjacent rooms or down the hall. With our outside room we had a great view of a distant thunderstorm. Shower worked great.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we have stayed in.

reviews.text: Last time I stayed in Eastern Shore, VA to visit family, I stayed at this dump (sorry can't remember the name of the hotel). So I wasn't sure what to expect from the Comfort Inn Onley. What a pleasant surprise. Our room and bathroom was very clean and comfortable. The staffs there were very nice and accommodating. The hotel sits in a great location, right across the street from a shopping center and not far from nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Clean Place to Stay

reviews.text: Nice, clean room w/ Jacuzzi and fridge. Convenient location to various Restaurants and State Parks Campsite/Beaches.
reviews.title: Nice Place
Nice place to stay
reviews.text: we stayed here on our journey to the Outer Banks. Clean, comfortable room, nice pool and convenient next door family restaurant. Friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel!
reviews.text: We had to visit the area on business and booked the last room at this hotel for the weekend--the king jacuzzi suite. The Comfort Inn is not the Ritz Carlton (so we weren't expecting the Ritz) but we thought that the room was very nice, large, and clean and had a nifty tub in middle of the living area. The staff was very pleasant and we were able to surf the web with the hotel's wireless access. The location is very close to Onancock, where we had an excellent dinner at Bizzotto's in downtown. We would definitely stay here again.

This hotel had the filthiest room I've ever stayed in in my life -- the bathroom had water stains in the toilet, bugs on the floor and dust everywhere. The carpet in the room looked like it hadn't been vaccumed in weeks, the room reeked of stale cigarettes to the point we left the door open to air it out. Just disgusting -- stay somewhere else!
reviews.title: Worst room I've ever stayed in!

reviews.text: From the very beginning, the management was not very friendly to me and my friends who had traveled there to ski, and was giving us a terrible time for wanting to split up the rooms and use different credit cards. Hot breakfast was good, but the staff, cleanliness, professionalism, and consumer oriented behavior was not acceptable. I will look to stay at the Best Western Kachina in Taos if I ever travel there again.
reviews.title: Management needs a makeover

reviews.text: The staff was very nice, however, there is no quality here
reviews.title: no quality

reviews.text: We stayed here based on the fact that it had a full served breakfast and we thought it would be nice to have something different than the standard continental breakfasts that we had for the rest of the trip. It was not worth it. The hallways smelled like old stale smoke and our youngest kid plugged his nose on our way to breakfast in the morning. We had a large 2 story room with a king bed and bathroom upstairs and a queen wallbed and pullout couch in the downstairs sitting room. The downstairs air conditioner had so much mold on it that we couldn't use it without making the air smell worse. There was a small 18" window upstairs that we opened to try to air out the room. The downstairs room had a door that opened up into the outdoor pool courtyard. We kept that open as much as possible.
reviews.title: Terrible air - smoky and moldy - it made me feel sick.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only good part about this hotel was the pool. It was outdoors, very clean and goes to 9 ft deep! The kids ranked it as the best pool of the whole trip but the worst hotel.
reviews.title: Pretty Nice with one exception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To get to the point, my exception related to the free Wireless service. The reception was terrible, even when I went to the lobby to try to get closer to the server. I called their technical support but the guy wanted to change my settings and I knew my computer was not at fault. It was fine for me to do without internet for a day!!!! Others may not like it.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Husband is from near this area. We stayed here a few times when we are in town visiting. The last time I had issues with the cleanliness of the hotel and do not intend to stay again. Unfortunately, there are very few hotels in this part of the state. I am trying B&Bs instead.
reviews.title: Would not stay again
Good location for Eastern Shore
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during late October 2004 and found the location great for our needs. It is centrally located for any Eastern Shore activity. We had a king bed, a table with two chairs, and plenty of storage. The breakfast was a basic cont. - fruit, coffee, pastry, cereal, milk and juice.
